original_title: Survived By: One Year After the Capital Gazette Shooting
overview: On June 28, 2018, 5 employees of the Annapolis Capital Gazette were killed in a mass shooting. WUSA9’s Mike Wise followed the families of the victims for weeks. Summer Geimer tells the story of how her mother, Wendi Winters, charged the shooter and the lives that were saved because of that act. Andrea Chamblee and Maria Hiaasen – the widows of John McNamara and Rob Hiaasen shared how they’ve spent the last year after losing their husbands. Survived By details how these survivors spent the past year navigating their grief and advocating for change.
title: Survived By: One Year After the Capital Gazette Shooting
